text: Arcadia is a city in Crawford County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2020 census, 254 people lived there. == History == Arcadia was founded in 1862. It was named for the ancient region of Arcadia, in Greece. The first post office in Arcadia was founded in June 1867. Arcadia was a station on the St. Louisâ€“San Francisco Railway. == Geography == Arcadia is at (37.641233, -94.624028). According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. == People == === 2020 census === As of the 2020 census, there were 254 people, 128 households, and 69 families living in the city. Of the households, 72.7% owned their home and 27.3% rented their home. The median age was 45.5 years. Of the people, 93.3% were White, 0.4% were Native American, 1.2% were from some other race, and 5.1% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 2.0% of the people. === 2010 census === As of the 2010 census says that there were 310 people, 136 households, and 79 families living in the city. == References == == Other websites == ;City * Arcadia - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 246 , local school district ;Maps * Arcadia City Map , KDOT Category:1862 establishments in Kansas Category:Cities in Crawford County, Kansas
title: Arcadia, Kansas
